dillon.gameAPI.utils

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • dillon.gameAPI.utils.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an animation within the game.
    Since:
    V2.1.0
    Author:
    Dillon - Github dg092099

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames,
                 int animationSpeed,
                 int loops)
        Instantiate an animation object.
        Parameters:
        frames - The frames (Must be more than 2.)
        animationSpeed - The amount of updates that must execute to proceed the animation.
        loops - The amount of times that the animation loops. 1 For doesn't loop. -1 for always loops. 0 causes issues with the animation finishing before it happens (Don't set it to that).

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Causes the animation to progress if able.

      • getCurrentFrame

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getCurrentFrame()
        Get the current animation frame.
        Returns:
        The frame.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Gets if the animation is at the end. It will not progress further.
        Returns:
        At the end.

      • getFrames

        public java.awt.Image[] getFrames()
        Get the frames of the animation.
        Returns:
        The frames.

      • createFromZip

        public static Animation createFromZip(java.io.InputStream is)
        Create an animation from a zip file. The frames should be numbered.
        Parameters:
        is - The input stream.
        Returns:
        The animation

      • createFromZip

        public static Animation createFromZip(java.net.URL url)

      • getLoops

        public int getLoops()
        Returns:
        The amount of times that the animation will loop.

      • setLoops

        public void setLoops(int loops)
        Parameters:
        loops - times the animation should loop.

      • getAnimationSpeed

        public int getAnimationSpeed()
        Returns:
        How fast the animation should play.
